newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: British tourists held in Venezuelan cocaine bust.
newsitem.headline: British tourists held in Venezuelan cocaine bust.

text.p: Two British tourists were detained on Thursday by Venezuela's Anti-Drug Enforcement Authority after customs officials said they found 10 kilos (22 pounds) of cocaine strapped around their chests at Caracas international airport.

James Milles and Paul Clark were bound for London on a VIASA flight after a 10-day stay in Venezuela when they were stopped at customs. Each allegedly had about five kilos (11 pounds) of cocaine packed into special jackets they were wearing under their shirts.
The two men, who said they were innocent, were being held in custody but there was no indication when they might be charged.

"We're innocent, we haven't done anything," Milles told Reuters from his detention room. "A man put a pistol against our heads, he was going to shoot us and told us to go through the airport, through customs ... He watched us do it all."
No further details were immediately available about the two travelers, who said they were in Venezuela for a vacation The British Embassy had no details of their home towns.
